thread.title: Expect delays, crowded light-rail trains Saturday
thread.title_full: Expect delays, crowded light-rail trains Saturday | The Seattle Times

author: Seattle Times staff
title: Expect delays, crowded light-rail trains Saturday
text:
Light-rail trains will show up less often than usual Saturday, because of routine bridge inspections along the five-mile elevated segment through Tukwila.
Trains will run 20 minutes apart, instead of the usual 10-minute frequency , from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. Trains running north and south will take turns on a single track in Tukwila, spreading delays all the way to downtown Seattle and the airport.
In addition, Sound Transit will keep its usual two-car trainset, instead of expanding to a third railcar, so trips will be more crowded. About 34,000 passengers ride on summer Saturdays.
The agency chose not to take on labor costs to assemble longer trains for just one day, since no huge public events were scheduled, said spokeswoman Kimberly Reason.
